text.p: Babel is a set of tools to manage versions of your favorite programming languages.
To use this GO version, run version script that list all installed versions:
text.source: $ version go Please choose a version: 0: Default 1: 1.0.3 2: 1.1.2 3: 1.2.2 * 4: 1.3.3 4 Selecting go version '1.3.3' $ go version go version go1.3.3 linux/amd64
text.p: This tool is able to build and manage following programming languages:

list.item: Go
Lua
Python
Ruby
Java

text.p: Build scripts builds and install VMs or compiler in directory /opt/<lang>/<version>. Thus GO 1.3.3 would be installed in directory /opt/go/1.3.3.
Script version selects a given version by making a symbolic link between /opt/<lang>/<version> and /opt/<lang>/current.
Thus, if you put directory /opt/<lang>/current/bin in your PATH, you would run selected version.
This system is straightforward and works fine.

list.item: Drop scripts somewhere in your PATH.
Create directories /opt/go, i/opt/lua, /opt/python, /opt/ruby and/or /opt/java depending on which language you want to manage.

text.p: Build your VMs with scripts <lang>-build version (except for Java that you install already built in appropriate directory /opt/java/&lt:version>).

list.item: go-build script will install a given compiler and GO tools.
version go script will switch between these versions.

text.p: You must set following environment variables:

list.item: PATH: must include /opt/go/current/bin.
GOROOT: must be /opt/go/current.
GOPATH: must be set as you wish (~/go for instance).

text.p: Even if tests fail (which is the case for release 1.1 for instance), the compiler is installed. Nevertheless, tools are not.

list.item: lua-build script will build the VM for the given version.
version lua script will switch between these versions.
python-build script will build the VM for given version.
version python script will switch between these versions.

text.p: To build Python VM, you must install ifollowing development libraries:

list.item: tetex-nox and latex2html to generate documentation for 2.6 and earlier versions.
libreadline-dev to enable completion and line edition in interpreter.
libssl-dev to enable HTTPS.
libzip-dev, libtar-dev, libbz2-dev, zlib1g-dev to enable ZIP and TAR support.
libmysqld-dev, libmysqlclient-dev and python-dev to install MySQL driver.
libsqlite3-dev to enable sqlite3 support.
ruby-build script will build the VM for the given version.
version ruby script will switch between these versions.
There is no build script: drop Java tarball content in /opt/java/<version> directory.
version java script will switch between these versions.

text.p: You must set following environment variables:

list.item: PATH: must include /opt/go/current/bin.
JAVA_HOME: must be /opt/java/current.

text.p: You can download Babel here: https://github.com/c4s4/babel/releases.
